result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oscar Yovani Leiva Garcia

records.addlTxt:
ASJOURNED OFF THE RECORD. 
Defendant Oscar Yovani Leiva Garcia in court.  
Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court for Oscar Yovani Leiva Garcia.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin

Case in court for Plea and Sentencing.
Defense request an adjournment for reasons presented to the court.
State does not object. Defense request this case be placed on Branch 37 Disposition Calendar.
Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 37 for Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Oscar Yovani Leiva Garcia in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Status Conference.  Defense waives Interpreter's appearance.  Defense received Offer and Discovery and requested Plea/Sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am., assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Oscar Yovani Leiva Garcia in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter waived for purposes of scheduling. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Oscar Yovani Leiva Garcia in court with Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Oscar Yovani Leiva Garcia in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholowmew.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Matthew Luening received and filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 036114,
Payable Number: 999710,
Receipt Number: 22RP015166,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Oscar Yovani Leiva Garcia in court with attorney Eloisa De Leon.  Defendant Oscar Yovani Leiva Garcia in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Oscar Yovani Leiva Garcia appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
